verses.verse: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm of the sons of Korah. Hear <WH8085> this <WH5971>, all ye peoples; Give ear <WH238>, all ye inhabitants <WH3427> of the world <WH2465>,
Both low <WH1121> and high <WH1121>, Rich <WH6223> and poor <WH34> together <WH3162>.
My mouth <WH6310> shall speak <WH1696> wisdom <WH2454>; And the meditation <WH1900> of my heart <WH3820> shall be of understanding <WH8394>.
I will incline <WH5186> mine ear <WH241> to a parable <WH4912>: I will open <WH6605> my dark saying <WH2420> upon the harp <WH3658>.
Wherefore should I fear <WH3372> in the days <WH3117> of evil <WH7451>, When iniquity <WH5771> at my heels <WH6120> compasseth me about <WH5437>?
They that trust <WH982> in their wealth <WH2428>, And boast <WH1984> themselves in the multitude <WH7230> of their riches <WH6239>;
None of them can <WH376> by any means <WH6299> redeem <WH6299> his brother <WH251>, Nor give <WH5414> to God <WH430> a ransom for him <WH3724>;
(For the redemption <WH6306> of their life <WH5315> is costly <WH3365>, And it faileth <WH2308> for ever <WH5769>;)
That he should still live <WH2421> alway <WH5331>, That he should not see <WH7200> corruption <WH7845>.
For he shall see <WH7200> it <WH2450>. Wise men die <WH4191>; The fool <WH3684> and the brutish <WH1198> alike <WH3162> perish <WH6>, And leave <WH5800> their wealth <WH2428> to others <WH312>.

Their inward <WH7130> thought is <WH1004>, that their houses shall continue for ever <WH5769>, And their dwelling-places <WH4908> to all <WH1755> generations <WH1755>; They call <WH7121> their lands <WH127> after their own names <WH8034>.
But man <WH120> being in honor <WH3366> abideth <WH3885> not <WH4911>: He is like the beasts <WH929> that perish <WH1820>.
This their way <WH1870> is their folly <WH3689>: Yet after them <WH310> men approve <WH7521> their sayings <WH6310>. <WH5542>[[Selah

They are appointed <WH8371> as a flock <WH6629> for Sheol <WH7585>; Death <WH4194> shall be their shepherd <WH7462>; And the upright <WH3477> shall have dominion <WH7287> over them in the morning <WH1242>; And their beauty <WH6697> shall be for Sheol <WH7585> to consume <WH1086>, That there be no habitation for it <WH2073>.
But God <WH430> will redeem <WH6299> my soul <WH5315> from the power <WH3027> of Sheol <WH7585>; For he will receive <WH3947> me <WH5542>. [[Selah
Be not thou afraid <WH3372> when one <WH376> is made rich <WH6238>, When the glory <WH3519> of his house <WH1004> is increased <WH7235>.
For when he dieth <WH4194> he shall carry nothing away <WH3947>; His glory <WH3519> shall not descend <WH3381> after him <WH310>.
Though while he lived <WH2416> he blessed <WH1288> his soul <WH5315> (And men praise <WH3034> thee <WH3190>, when thou doest well to thyself,)
He shall go <WH935> to the generation <WH1755> of his fathers <WH1>; They shall never <WH3808> see <WH7200> the light <WH216>.
Man <WH120> that is in honor <WH3366>, and understandeth <WH995> not <WH4911>, Is like the beasts <WH929> that perish <WH1820>.
